page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT NEAR SEISDON
page.content: Undoubtedly the major occupation in this area is farming, though as most of the farms are family ones they do not employ many other people. Horticulture also accounts for a number of jobs both in growing and dealing with the public. A few part-time jobs occur in the local public houses and restaurant. Probably the largest employer is the Egg Packing Station at Seisdon, though the majority of its employees are brought in by car from the Wolverhampton area and there is little employment there for local people except for the "Sunday girls". Other people living in this area, parcularly the younger ones have to travel some distance to work, probably in Bridgnorth or Wolverhampton. There unemployment is very high and it may be difficult to obtain work at all.
